Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 2 for SLE 15 SP6)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 2 for SLE 15 SP6)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 6.4.0-150600_23_14 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2024-40909: Fix a potential use-after-free in bpf_link_free() (bsc#1228349).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 15 SP6

Vulnerabilities.Description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

bpf: Fix a potential use-after-free in bpf_link_free()

After commit 1a80dbcb2dba, bpf_link can be freed by
link->ops->dealloc_deferred, but the code still tests and uses
link->ops->dealloc afterward, which leads to a use-after-free as
reported by syzbot. Actually, one of them should be sufficient, so
just call one of them instead of both. Also add a WARN_ON() in case
of any problematic implementation.
